x-metadata.name: Crop details
x-metadata.description: This section collects information on your crop’s yields, planting and soil characteristics. In the assessment, enter any physical or energy inputs used only for the crop and field you are assessing, including associated covers or managed field boundaries.
x-metadata.helpText: This can be a single field or the entire farm (if soil and management are the same). Set a boundary for all data you enter (cradle to farm gate recommended). Avoid duplicating counts (e.g. energy used for other cash crops) or overlooking emissions (e.g. transport of inputs). Bear in mind that this evaluation covers a complete annual harvest cycle lasting 12 months.

assessmentYear.title: Assessment year
assessmentYear.description: The assessment year, which is the year when the assessment concludes, such as from June 2022 to May 2023, would be designated as 2023.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

cropYield.title: Total harvested amount
cropYield.description:
Total harvested yield of crop from the ‘growing area’ above.
 This is before on-farm drying, grading, sorting or any other losses.
 Exclude co-products (co-products will be added in a future update).

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

farmGate.title: Farm gate ready amount
farmGate.description:
This value is used to scale emissions in the results shown under 'Emissions intensity by farm gate ready yield (kg CO₂e/tonne)'.
 Enter the weight of marketable crop after on-farm processing (e.g. drying, cleaning).
 Exclude co-products (co-products will be added in a future update). Emissions are allocated to this net yield.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

coProducts.title: Co-products
coProducts.description:
Co-products are secondary products produced alongside a primary crop, either by choice (co-cropping) or as a direct result (like straw).
 By adding any co-products, and their value relative to the net primary crop, you will share the impacts from your assessment between the primary crop and its co-products.

mainCoProductLabel.title: Main product label
mainCoProductLabel.description:
This label is only used on the co-product specific aggregation.
 If left blank the selected crop type will be used as the main product label.

coProductPercentage.title: Co-product percentage
coProductPercentage.description: Enter value for co-product as a % relative to primary crop. For example, if Grain $1000, Straw $100, enter 10%.

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

x-metadata.name: Crop residues
x-metadata.description: Default values for dry matter residue weights are provided. If you have better data, you can overwrite the default value by choosing 'Use manual Value'.
x-metadata.helpText:
Residue amount here is above-ground plant residues/left-overs and must be entered as 'dry weight'. Dry weights vary by crop type and can be around 90% compared to fresh weights for cereals and beans, or between 10 and 20 % for many fruits/vegetables.
 This result only includes emissions from residue management. These residues also affect soil carbon if Tier 2 SOC is used but not the Tier 1 SOC model.

residueManagementPractice.title: Residue management practice
residueManagementPractice.description:
Please select the most apporpriate residue management practice.
 Know that emissions can vary substantially for different practices.
 This accounts for emissions from the predominant method of how residues are managed (e.g. production of compost).

residueAGManual.title: Enter above ground residue dry matter

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

x-metadata.name: Waste water
x-metadata.description:
**You can skip this section if any of the following apply**. Note that no emissions are calculated for these scenarios, and they will not impact the overall emission results.


- Pools of standing waste water or reservoirs are not managed in this crop.
- The average annual temperature of your farm is lower than 15°C.
x-metadata.helpText: Waste water includes run off from land, livestock, waste management (such as slurry), and any cleaning, washing or processing within the scope of your assessment.

treatmentProcess.title: Treatment process
treatmentProcess.description: Please select one of the following treatment process options.
enum: None - other than reservoirs, lakes and estuaries

value.description: A float that can take values positive or negative.

oxygenDemand.title: Oxygen demand
oxygenDemand.description: If unknown, use chemical oxygen demand type and 0.009 kg per litre for coffee. For other crops see technical description for default values.

value.description: A float that can take values positive or negative.

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

x-metadata.name: Pesticide
x-metadata.description: Details of rates of pesticide application are used to calculate the emissions from production.
x-metadata.helpText: Fewer options are available for crop protection inputs compared to fertilisers because less environmental data is available, so average emission factor values are used. Crop protection inputs generally contribute a lower proportion of emissions than fertilisers.

category.title: Category
category.description: The category of pesticide application, this is for reference purposes and not used in the calculations.

type.title: Pesticide type
type.description: Please select 'Pesticide' if the type is not specified.

fieldApplicationPercentage.title: Percentage (%) of the field the product was applied to

activeIngredientPercentage.title: Percentage (%) active ingredient
activeIngredientPercentage.description: Percentage of active ingredient included in each product applied - this can usually be found on the product label or on the manufacturer's website.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

x-metadata.name: Fertiliser
x-metadata.description: Enter information on fertiliser applications to the growing area and any associated catch/cover crops or managed field boundaries. If you cannot find your specific fertiliser type listed, either select the fertiliser that closely matches your own or select 'Compose your own NPK' and indicate the percentage of active ingredients and the nitrogen (N) composition you applied.
x-metadata.helpText: This section calculates emissions from production and application of fertilisers. No production emissions are assumed for manure (as it's considered a waste product of dairy/beef production). Don't forget to enter the fuel used to apply these inputs in the 'Fuel and energy' section.

predefinedFertiliserType.title: Fertiliser type
enum: Compound NPK - 15% N / 15% K2O / 15% P2O5 (mixed-acid process)
Compound NPK - 15% N / 15% K2O / 15% P2O5 (nitrophosphate process)
Muriate of potash / Potassium chloride - 60% K2O

predefinedEmissionFactorRegionKey.title: Fertiliser production region
predefinedEmissionFactorRegionKey.description: If you're unsure, choose the default region. Organic fertilisers can ignore this field and select any option. This list includes all regions for all types of fertilisers. However, certain fertilisers have emission factors only for specific regions. The model first tries to use a region-specific emission factor. If that's not available, it uses a global emission factor. If neither is available, it uses any emission factor it can find.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

predefinedDateOfApplication.title: Date of application
predefinedDateOfApplication.description: This is optional and currently does not impact results.

predefinedNitrificationInhibitorUsed.title: Nitrification inhibitor
predefinedNitrificationInhibitorUsed.description: Only applicable for fertilisers with non-nitrate Nitrogen containing fertilisers (e.g. ammonia, urea)

oneOf.title: Use manual value
oneOf.description: Cool Farm is not responsible for emission factor changes. Please use data responsibly.

manualEmissionFactor.title: Manual emission factor
manualEmissionFactor.description: A float that can take positive values.

supportingNotes.title: Supporting notes
supportingNotes.description: Purpose of why you have added a custom emission factor

cyoNAsAmmoniumNPercentage.title: % N (as ammonium-N)
cyoNAsAmmoniumNPercentage.description: % ammonium-N in fertiliser. Note that this should not be higher than 77.65%.

cyoNAsNitrateNPercentage.title: % N (as nitrate-N)
cyoNAsNitrateNPercentage.description: % nitrate-N in fertiliser. Note that this should not be higher than 22%.

cyoNAsUreaNPercentage.title: % N (as urea-N)
cyoNAsUreaNPercentage.description: % urea-N in fertiliser. Note that this should not be higher than 46%.

cyoP2o5Percentage.title: % P2O5
cyoP2o5Percentage.description: % phosphorus pentoxide (P2O5) in fertiliser. Ability to enter P directly will be added in a future version. To manually convert P to P2O5, divide P by 0.436.

cyoK2oPercentage.title: % K2O
cyoK2oPercentage.description: % potassium oxide (K2O) in fertiliser. Ability to enter K directly will be added in a future version. To manually convert K to K2O, divide K by 0.830.

cyoApplicationRate.description: Total weight of fertiliser applied. For example for 100% ammonium include both the weight from the NH4-N component as well as the NH4-H component.
cyoApplicationRate.title: Application rate

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

cyoDateOfApplication.title: Date of application
cyoDateOfApplication.description: This is optional and currently does not impact results.

cyoNitrificationInhibitorUsed.title: Nitrification inhibitor
cyoNitrificationInhibitorUsed.description:
Select if using nitrification inhibitor.
 Only applicable for fertilisers with non-nitrate Nitrogen containing fertilisers (e.g. ammonia, urea).

oneOf.title: Use manual value
oneOf.description: Cool Farm is not responsible for emission factor changes. Please use data responsibly.

manualEmissionFactor.title: Manual emission factor
manualEmissionFactor.description: A float that can take positive values.

supportingNotes.title: Supporting notes
supportingNotes.description: Purpose of why you have added a custom emission factor

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

x-metadata.name: Fuel and energy
x-metadata.description: Enter total electricity and fuels used for the production and on-farm processing of the assessed crop and the entire growing area, including on farm storage, lighting, drying, cooling, ventilation, irrigation, and possible energy used by contractors. Refrigerant emissions can be entered in their own section.
x-metadata.helpText: If you don't have exact data records from meters and bills (most accurate), you can use the machinery, irrigation and transport sections instead - but make sure not to double-count energy or fuel used. If you work with multiple crops/fields, you could allocate fuel and energy based on size of growing area, the product weight, or its economic value.

usages.title: List of fuel and energy usage

byVolumeEnergySource.title: Energy source
byVolumeEnergySource.description:
The energy source (usage measured by volume of fuel).
Biodiesel ME (FAME) is the traditional, widely used biodiesel produced via transesterification.
Biodiesel HVO (Renewable Diesel) is a newer, advanced biofuel with properties closer to fossil diesel, produced via hydrotreatment.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

byVolumeEnergyBoundary.title: Boundary
enum: Incoming to farm for on-farm use

byVolumeCategory.title: Category of energy used if within farm operations
byVolumeCategory.description: Only applicable to energy used within farm operations. This category is used in report disaggregations.

byWeightEnergySource.title: Energy source
byWeightEnergySource.description: The energy source (usage measured by weight of fuel).

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

byWeightEnergyBoundary.title: Boundary
enum: Incoming to farm for on-farm use

byWeightCategory.title: Category of energy used if within farm operations
byWeightCategory.description: Only applicable to energy used within farm operations. This category is used in report disaggregations.

byEnergyEnergySource.title: Energy source
byEnergyEnergySource.description: The energy source (usage measured in units of energy).

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

byEnergyEnergyBoundary.title: Boundary
enum: Incoming to farm for on-farm use

byEnergyCategory.title: Category of energy used if within farm operations
byEnergyCategory.description: Only applicable to energy used within farm operations. This category is used in report disaggregations.

byGridEnergySource.title: Energy source
byGridEnergySource.description: The grid energy source (usage measured in units of energy).

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

byGridEnergyBoundary.title: Boundary
enum: Incoming to farm for on-farm use

byGridEnergyCategory.title: Category of energy used if within farm operations
byGridEnergyCategory.description: Only applicable to energy used within farm operations. This category is used in report disaggregations.

allOf.title: Use manual value
allOf.description: Cool Farm is not responsible for emission factor changes. Please use data responsibly.

manualEmissionFactor.title: Manual emission factor
manualEmissionFactor.description: A float that can take positive values.

supportingNotes.title: Supporting notes
supportingNotes.description: Reason for adding a custom emission factor.

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

x-metadata.name: Irrigation energy
x-metadata.description: This step estimates fuel and energy consumption for irrigation when actual fuel or energy usage data is unavailable or incomplete.
x-metadata.helpText:
Using actual fuel or energy data is preferable whenever possible and can be entered directly into the 'Fuel and energy' section, but beware of double counting (don't enter in both sections).
 You may add multiple entries with different methods of irrigation and sources of water.
 This is currently for energy emissions only and not for water-use as part of the water model.

irrigationMethod.title: Method
irrigationMethod.description: If irrigation option missing, select closest.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.
A float that can take positive values.
A float that can take positive values.
A float that can take positive values.
A float that can take positive values.

horizontalDistance.title: Horizontal pumping distance
horizontalDistance.description: Horizontal distance pumped up to the nozzle.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

x-metadata.name: Transport
x-metadata.description: This section estimates fuel and energy consumption for transport and should only be used if actual fuel or energy use data is unavailable or incomplete, as this can differ significantly among transport modes. Enter actual data directly under the 'Fuel and energy' section, but beware of double counting.
x-metadata.helpText:
Examples of incoming transport are fertiliser, pesticides, and seeds moved from the point of purchase to your growing area. Include transport even if you don't own or operate the vehicles. If your assessment boundary is to 'farm-gate' only, you can exclude transport to dispatch of (co-)products from farm to the next destination, such as a processor or point of sale.
 
 You can combine multiple journeys in one entry if vehicle and distance are the same. For example, if two tonnes of fertiliser are transported 20km by heavy goods vehicle five times over the year, you can enter: HGV, 10 tonnes, 20km.

boundary.title: Boundary
boundary.description: Categorise the transport by where it occurred.
enum: Incoming to farm for on-farm use

weight.title: Weight
weight.description: The weight of the item(s) transported.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

distance.title: Distance
distance.description: The distance the item(s) have been transported.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

x-metadata.name: Machinery operations
x-metadata.description: This step estimates the use of diesel and biodiesel for farm machines when actual fuel use data is missing or not complete. These estimates are a backup option and should only be used if you don't have the actual data.
x-metadata.helpText: Since fuel use can vary a lot between different farm machines, it's always better to use actual data if you have it. You can directly input this actual data into the 'Fuel and energy' section.

soilType.title: Soil type
soilType.description:
The type of soil machinery is being used on.
 Coarse includes:
 Sand, loamy sand, sandy loam, loam, silt loam and silt.
 
Medium includes:
 Sandy clay loam, clay loam and silty clay loam.
 
Fine includes:
 Sandy clay, silty clay and clay.
 This is used in the machinery model currently.

machine.title: Machine type
enum: Pressing of dry crop (straw/hay) high-density pick-up baler (13 kg/bale)
Forage harvester - corn hoeing with chipper

fuelUse.title: Fuel type
fuelUse.description:
The type of diesel fuel used in the machinery.
Biodiesel ME (FAME) is the traditional, widely used biodiesel produced via transesterification.
Biodiesel HVO (Renewable Diesel) is a newer, advanced biofuel with properties closer to fossil diesel, produced via hydrotreatment.

numberMachineryOperations.title: Number of operations
numberMachineryOperations.description:
If machine type is one of:
- 'Baler', 
- 'Baler (250 kg round bale)', 
- 'Baler (250 kg square bale)'
- 'Pressing of dry crop (straw/hay) high-density pick-up baler (13 kg/bale)'
- 'Wrapping of bales'
Then the number of operations should consist of the 'number of bales/ha' multiplied by the 'number of operations'. 
E.g. if there are 4 operations, 3 bales/ha and 2 ha. The user should enter 4x3=12 bales/ha in the number of operations field.

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

machineryUse.label: Lots of manure spreading throughout the year

x-metadata.name: Non-crop biomass, estimated
x-metadata.description: Use this section to record intercrop trees, shade trees, and hedges planted in the last 20 years.
x-metadata.helpText:
It's a simple Tier 1 estimation method to calculate the carbon captured by these plants, shown as CO2 equivalents in the yearly and total crop lifecycle results.
 
 This can not be used for reporting. More detailed measurement options for reporting can be found in the non crop measured section, please use non crop measured where possible, and be careful not to double count biomass across non crop measured and non crop estimated.

type.title: Intercrop type
type.description: Currently, only these trees are available. If you'd like to suggest others, please contact support.

percentageOccupied.title: Percentage (%) occupied
percentageOccupied.description: The percentage of the growing area on which the intercrops are planted.

value.description: An integer that can take values of 1 and above.

type.title: Shade tree type
type.description: Currently, only these trees are available. If you'd like to suggest others, please contact support.
enum: Tropical shade trees in wet areas - canopy trees
Tropical shade trees in wet areas - understory
Tropical shade trees in dry areas

percentageOccupied.title: Percentage (%) occupied
percentageOccupied.description: The percentage of the growing area on which the shade trees are planted.

value.description: An integer that can take values of 1 and above.
A float that can take positive values.
A float that can take positive values.

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

x-metadata.name: Non-crop biomass, measured
x-metadata.description:
Add annual changes for the biomass of trees growing within or immediately adjacent to the field assessment area. Ensure these are not counted in adjoining crop assessments to prevent double counting.
As per GHG Protocol, you should only account for increased biomass if the biomass is permanent and additional. Trees or orchards that have been there > 20 years or the lifecycle of the perennial crop should not be included. If unsure, be conservative and do not include.

type.title: Tree type
type.description: The type of non-crop tree. Required for the Non Crop Measured model.
enum: Shade (Cordia alliodora, Juglans olanchana, Inga tonduzzi, I. punctata)

treesPlantedOrLost.title: Net number of trees planted (+) or removed (-)
treesPlantedOrLost.description: The net change in the number of trees across the entire field in the current year. A positive number means more are planted than are lost and vice versa.

percentageOfAreaOccupiedPreviousYear.title: Percentage occupied (previous year)
percentageOfAreaOccupiedPreviousYear.description: The percentage of the growing area on which this tree species was planted in the previous year.

plantingDensityPreviousYear.title: Planting density (previous year)
plantingDensityPreviousYear.description: Enter the number of trees per occupied area (not the total growing area). For example, if 2 trees are planted in 0.5 ha of a 1 ha growing area (i.e. percentage occupied = 0.5), the correct planting density is 4 trees/ha (2 ÷ 0.5), not 2 trees/ha.

value.description: An integer that can take values of 1 and above.

measurements.title: Measurement format
measurements.description: Standard deviation is required here if you would like uncertainty measures in your results.

measurementPreviousYear.title: Sample tree measurements (previous year)
measurementPreviousYear.description:
Measurements of sample trees in the previous year.
 Dependent on the species;
 - diameter at 15cm from the ground
 - diameter at breast height
 - height
 Please check the technical description for the corresponding measurement.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

measurementCurrentYear.title: Sample tree measurements (current year)
measurementCurrentYear.description:
Measurements of sample trees in the current year.
 Dependent on the species;
 - diameter at 15cm from the ground
 - diameter at breast height
 - height
 Please check the technical description for the corresponding measurement.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

measurementPreviousYear.title: Sample tree measurements (previous year)
measurementPreviousYear.description:
Measurements of sample trees in the previous year.
 Dependent on the species;
 - diameter at 15cm from the ground
 - diameter at breast height
 - height
 Please check the technical description for the corresponding measurement.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

sd.title: Standard deviation
sd.description: The standard deviation of the sample tree measurements.

sampleSize.title: Sample size
sampleSize.description: The number of sample trees used to calculate the mean and sd.

measurementCurrentYear.title: Sample tree measurements (current year)
measurementCurrentYear.description:
Measurements of sample trees in the current year.
 Dependent on the species;
 - diameter at 15cm from the ground
 - diameter at breast height
 - height
 Please check the technical description for the corresponding measurement.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

sd.title: Standard deviation
sd.description: The standard deviation of the sample tree measurements.

sampleSize.title: Sample size
sampleSize.description: The number of sample trees used to calculate the mean and sd.

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

x-metadata.name: Re / deforestation
x-metadata.description: Please enter details of any deforestation or reforestation of native forest that has occurred within the bounds of your growing area during the past 20 years.
x-metadata.helpText:
We will use this information to calculate emissions or reductions relating to the gain or loss of tree biomass.
 This model will return zero emissions/removals if the event occurred more than 20 years ago.
 This is a Tier 1 model and should not be used for reporting removals.

yearsSinceLUC.title: Years since the forestry event
yearsSinceLUC.description: The number of years between the forestry event and the assessment year.

affectedArea.title: Area affected by change in forestry

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

yearsSinceLUC.title: Years since the forestry event
yearsSinceLUC.description: The number of years between the forestry event and the assessment year.

deforestationForestAgeYears.title: Age of forest removed
deforestationForestAgeYears.description: The age of the forest when it was deforested, in years (unique field for forest biomass, only needed when deforested).

yearsSinceLUC.title: Years since the forestry event
yearsSinceLUC.description: The number of years between the forestry event and the assessment year.

affectedArea.title: Area affected by change in forestry

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

x-metadata.name: Refrigerants
x-metadata.description: This section collects information about the refrigerants used in the crop production and in equipment used in the farm.

equipments.title: Equipment using refrigerants
equipments.description: If the product is stored in a refrigerated or air-conditioned facility on your farm, please list the equipment here to account for refrigerant emissions. Energy use for this equipment should be included in the 'Fuel and energy' tab.

subapplication.title: Equipment type
subapplication.description: Type of refrigeration or air-conditioning equipment. For a description of the different types of equipment, see the technical description https://app.coolfarmtool.org/documentation/technical-description/crops/index.html

unitCount.title: Number of identical equipment units
unitCount.description: Only count identical equipment that is the same age.

refrigerant.title: Refrigerant type
refrigerant.description: Refrigerant type that is contained within equipment.

unitAge.title: Age of equipment
unitAge.description: Age of refrigeration or air-conditioning equipment in years.

equipmentEOL.title: Select if these equipment units were disposed of within the assessment period

refrigerantRecoveryType.title: Refrigerant recovery pathway
refrigerantRecoveryType.description: Type of refrigerant recovery for equipment disposed of (leave blank if not disposed of).

initialRefrigerantAmount.title: Initial refrigerant amount
initialRefrigerantAmount.description: Quantity of refrigerant contained within equipment when fully charged.

value.description: A float that can take positive values.

allocation.title: Allocation method and percentage
allocation.description: Default uses 100% allocated and unspecified allocation method.

allocationMethod.title: Allocation method
allocationMethod.description:
Approach used to allocate refrigerant emissions between different products.
 Mass is by product weight only, physical accounts for time the product used equipment and the space required.

allocationPercentage.title: Allocation percentage
allocationPercentage.description: Percentage of refrigerant emissions allocated to this product.

userNotes.title: User notes
userNotes.description: A free text field for adding any notes related to this input section.

x-metadata.name: Soil carbon changes
x-metadata.description: This section deals with carbon stored in or released from your soil due to recent changes in land use or management practices.
x-metadata.helpText:
Use the Tier 1 model if land use has changed at any point in the last 20 years. This model is required if the deforestation model has been used.
 Use the Tier 2 model if the land has been cropland for the last 20 years, and you want to model land management changes.
 The Tier 2 model is sensitive to historical data because it calculates changes (ΔSOC) relative to a baseline. For example, underestimating past inputs like fertiliser or residues could lead to an overestimation of improvements in the assessment year. Accurate historical data improves result reliability.
 We always try to use the most up-to-date weather data we can. This means if you re-run an assessment for which future weather data was previously generated, we’ll now use real data and the results may change slightly.

oneOf.title: Tier 1 SOC model - Land use and management practices changes

soilClassification.title: Soil classification
soilClassification.description:
This is the type of soil according to IPCC classification.
 If unknown, enter 'High activity clay' as a sensible default.
 Or you can use the soil-characteristic api endpoint
 /api-docs/soil-characteristic

changes.description: Add a list of up to four land use or management practice changes.

year.title: Year
year.description: The year in which the land use change occurred.

fromState.title: Previous State
fromState.description: The land use and management practices before the change was made.

landUse.title: Land use
landUse.description:
Culivated: Represents area that has been converted from native conditions and continuously managed for predominantly annual crops over 50 yrs.
 
 Paddy: Long-term (> 20 year) annual cropping of wetlands (paddy rice). Can include double-cropping with non-flooded crops.
 
 Perennial: Long-term perennial tree crops such as fruit and nut trees, coffee and cacao.
 
 Set-aside: Represents temporary set aside of annually cropland (e.g., conservation reserves) or other idle cropland that has been revegetated with perennial grasses. A single year of set-aside is best represented by adjusting the carbon input factor, while two or more consecutive years can be modelled as a land-use change.
 
 Native: non-degraded, unimproved lands under native vegetation i.e. forest or grassland. Only select a transition to or from native grassland or forest once per assessment. Multiple selections may result in inaccurate results.

inputs.title: Carbon inputs
inputs.description:
This is a simplified summary of the carbon input categories, for a more precise description, see here (https://app.coolfarmtool.org/static/img/soc_decision_tree.jpg) for a decision tree.
 
 Low Carbon Inputs: Residue removed or burnt, bare ground for >6 months in last 3 years, low-yield crops, no fertilisation.
 
 Medium Carbon Inputs: Cereals with residue returned or supplemental organic matter, cover crops for >6 months in last 3 years or residue left on field (but not both).
 
 High Carbon Inputs (without manure): High residue inputs with cover crops for >6 months in last 3 years, ley system within three years, etc., but no manure.
 
 High Carbon Inputs (with manure): Regular addition of animal manure for increased carbon input at least once every three years, plus cover crops for >6 months in last 3 years, and residue left on field.
 
 Note: Slurry is ‘high without manure’, but if the user is applying enough slurry and there’s a significant Carbon input, then they can change it to ‘high with manure’. See tech description (section 2.9) for more details.
 
 If land use is not 'Cultivated' - set as 'Medium'. This will be done automatically in a future release.

tillage.title: Tillage
tillage.description:
Full: Substantial soil disturbance with full inversion and/or frequent (within year) tillage operations. At planting time, little (e.g., <30%) of the surface is covered by residues.
 
 Reduced: Primary and/or secondary tillage but with reduced soil disturbance (usually shallow and without full soil inversion). Normally leaves surface with >30% coverage by residues at planting.
 
 No-till: Direct seeding without primary tillage, with only minimal soil disturbance in the seeding zone. Herbicides are typically used for weed control.
 
 If land use is not 'Cultivated' - set as 'Full'. This will be done automatically in a future release.

toState.title: New State
toState.description: The land use and management practices after the change was made.

landUse.title: Land use
landUse.description:
Culivated: Represents area that has been converted from native conditions and continuously managed for predominantly annual crops over 50 yrs.
 
 Paddy: Long-term (> 20 year) annual cropping of wetlands (paddy rice). Can include double-cropping with non-flooded crops.
 
 Perennial: Long-term perennial tree crops such as fruit and nut trees, coffee and cacao.
 
 Set-aside: Represents temporary set aside of annually cropland (e.g., conservation reserves) or other idle cropland that has been revegetated with perennial grasses. A single year of set-aside is best represented by adjusting the carbon input factor, while two or more consecutive years can be modelled as a land-use change.
 
 Native: non-degraded, unimproved lands under native vegetation i.e. forest or grassland. Only select a transition to or from native grassland or forest once per assessment. Multiple selections may result in inaccurate results.

inputs.title: Carbon inputs
inputs.description:
This is a simplified summary of the carbon input categories, for a more precise description, see here (https://app.coolfarmtool.org/static/img/soc_decision_tree.jpg) for a decision tree.
 
 Low Carbon Inputs: Residue removed or burnt, bare ground for >6 months in last 3 years, low-yield crops, no fertilisation.
 
 Medium Carbon Inputs: Cereals with residue returned or supplemental organic matter, cover crops for >6 months in last 3 years or residue left on field (but not both).
 
 High Carbon Inputs (without manure): High residue inputs with cover crops for >6 months in last 3 years, ley system within three years, etc., but no manure.
 
 High Carbon Inputs (with manure): Regular addition of animal manure for increased carbon input at least once every three years, plus cover crops for >6 months in last 3 years, and residue left on field.
 
 Note: Slurry is ‘high without manure’, but if the user is applying enough slurry and there’s a significant Carbon input, then they can change it to ‘high with manure’. See tech description (section 2.9) for more details.
 
 If land use is not 'Cultivated' - set as 'Medium'. This will be done automatically in a future release.

tillage.title: Tillage
tillage.description:
Full: Substantial soil disturbance with full inversion and/or frequent (within year) tillage operations. At planting time, little (e.g., <30%) of the surface is covered by residues.
 
 Reduced: Primary and/or secondary tillage but with reduced soil disturbance (usually shallow and without full soil inversion). Normally leaves surface with >30% coverage by residues at planting.
 
 No-till: Direct seeding without primary tillage, with only minimal soil disturbance in the seeding zone. Herbicides are typically used for weed control.
 
 If land use is not 'Cultivated' - set as 'Full'. This will be done automatically in a future release.

appliedToFieldPercentage.title: Percentage (%) of field change applies to.
appliedToFieldPercentage.description:
From 0-100%, this percentage applies to the whole field and applies proportionally to all prior changes.
 E.g. suppose the most recent change converts 20% of the field from reduced till to no-till and the change before that converted 40% of the field from full to reduced till. The current state is then 48% ((1-0.4)*(1-0.2)) full till, 32% (0.4*(1-0.2)) reduced till and 20% no-till (12% from full till, 8% from reduced till).
 If unsure, create a new assessment for the different field areas.

oneOf.title: Tier 2 SOC model - Management changes to land that has been cropland (inc. set aside/fallow) for at least 20 years

sandPercentage.title: Percentage (%) of sand in soil
sandPercentage.description:
The percentage of sand in the soil to be used in the SOC model.
 This information should be available from laboratory soil analysis or you can use a jar test to assess yourself details of how to do this can be found here.
 https://ahdb.org.uk/knowledge-library/how-to-determine-soil-texture

tillage.title: Tillage
tillage.description: No-till refers to direct seeding without primary tillage and minimal soil disturbance, typically relying on herbicides for weed control. Reduced tillage involves primary and/or secondary tillage with reduced, shallow disturbance and no full soil inversion, usually leaving more than 30% of the surface covered by residues at planting. Full tillage involves substantial soil disturbance with full inversion and/or frequent tillage, typically leaving less than 30% residue cover at planting. For perennial crops, ensure that any tillage in the establishment year is specified.

percentageCoverage.title: Percentage of cover crop coverage
percentageCoverage.description: Percentage of the field area covered in cover crops.

biomassLeftInFieldPercentage.title: Percentage of cover crop biomass left in field

biomassLeftInFieldManagement.title: Management of cover crop biomass left in field
biomassLeftInFieldManagement.description: Select the option that best describes how cover crop biomass is managed on your field. If all biomass is removed, then select N/A.

biomassRemovedFromFieldManagement.title: Management of cover crop biomass removed from field
biomassRemovedFromFieldManagement.description: Select the option that best describes how cover crop biomass is managed after it is removed from your field. If all biomass is left on the field, then select N/A.

defaultDataUsageOption.default: I can provide at least 5 years of detailed land management history
enum: I can provide at least 5 years of detailed land management history
Before the assessment crop, the recent (≤ 5 years) management was generally a tree crop

For perennial crops, ensure that any tillage in the establishment year is specified.
